title: What is a strategic focus? - Quora

response.answer_text: Strategic Focus is making decisions with the End in mind. For an individual, Strategic Focus may be maintaining a regular exercise routine to stay in shape to play on a competitive team or keeping their GPA at a certain level to be competitive for their ideal job, school or program. For an organization, Strategic Focus encompasses your long-range plan, strategic goals, and current priorities based on your goals and current market conditions. An organization lead with a clear view of where they ultimately want to go will employ their strategic thinking in all decision making and demonstrate strong Strategic Focus. Read more about Strategic Focus in this article. THREE SYMPTOMS YOU MAY LACK STRATEGIC FOCUS (AND WHAT TO DO ABOUT IT!)

It is one of countless catchphrases or catchwords businesses use to sound businesslike. It probably means a focus, or the pretense of a focus, on facts and reason, rather than on intuition or a wild guess. If there are any MBAs lurking here, they may have a more erudite answer. But I challenge them to speak in Plain English, not to define a catchword with a catchword.
